title: How to Connect a VCR to a ROKU TV

steps.title: Make sure every device is properly turned off so that there are no electrical difficulties.
steps.content: Make sure every device is properly turned off so that there are no electrical difficulties. Power surges occur when the flow of electricity is interrupted, then started again. Also, when something sends electricity flowing back into the system.

steps.title: Turn the VCR around and connect the correctly colored RCA cable to each input.
steps.content: Turn the VCR around and connect the correctly colored RCA cable to each input. Make sure the yellow plugs connected with the yellow input, the red plug with the red input and the white outlet with the white input.

steps.title: Turn the VCR back around and connect the other end of each RCA cable to the outlets on the side of your ROKU TV.
steps.content: Turn the VCR back around and connect the other end of each RCA cable to the outlets on the side of your ROKU TV. This will be located on the left side of the television.

steps.title: Plug the VCR and television are into a wall outlet.
steps.content: Plug the VCR and television are into a wall outlet.

steps.title: Finally, pop in a VHS and enjoy the motion picture presentation!
steps.content: Finally, pop in a VHS and enjoy the motion picture presentation! In 1988 fully half of American homes owned VCRs - and by 2003, VCR penetration had reached over 90% with just 74 million homes receiving cable TV versus a whopping 98 Million homes equipped with VCRs.
